frontmatter.title: How NOT to set nil in UserDefaults
frontmatter.mdxPreview:
To clear a value from UserDefaults, I previously thought it was fine to do something like this:
```swift
UserDefaults.standard.set(nil, forKey: "myKey")
```
Turns out that this works differently in different iOS versions. Starting in iOS 11, setting nil for a key works as I expected.

frontmatter.title: Casting a pointer to UInt in Swift
frontmatter.mdxPreview: There are some times in Swift, like when using [System Trace](https://developer.apple.com/videos/play/wwdc2016/411/), that you want to get the pointer value of an object directly as a `UInt` (passing the pointer to `kdebug_signpost` is one). I was surprised at how hard it was to find documentation on how to get a Swift referenceâ€™s pointer value as a `UInt`.
